p: It is unclear why the measles virus persists in patients developing SSPE years after an initial uneventful measles rash. Children who develop SSPE are usually between 5 and 15 years old, with males more affected than females [ 1]. Measles before the age of 18 months poses the greatest risk for developing SSPE [ 1]. The onset is unannounced, and hallmarked by behavioral changes, neurocognitive decline and movement disorders [ 1]. It is often associated with myoclonus, and the EEG pattern is fairly typical. The disease rapidly progresses to a vegetative state, and affected patients may die within months, and up to 3 years after the onset of the disease [ 1].
